metadata.title: CVE-2017-15407 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Out-of-bounds Write in the QUIC networking stack in Google Chrome prior to63.0.3239.84 allowed a remote attacker to gain code execution via amalicious server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15407` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
